text:
I have found myself in a situation where code that was working just recently now gets stuck forever with 100% CPU utilization.  If I ctrl-C the program I get a crash with a long stack trace with stuff like
```jl_add_to_ee at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/src/jitlayers.cpp:1134 [inlined]
_jl_compile_codeinst at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/src/jitlayers.cpp:154
jl_generate_fptr at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/src/jitlayers.cpp:352
jl_compile_method_internal at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/src/gf.c:1971```
. I have no real idea how to debug this problem, if I try to reduce it to just calling the function where it get's stuck with the same input types exactly, the problem is not there anymore. I'm on v1.6-rc1. Anyone got any ideas to offer? :slightly_smiling_face:
